intro: Plagianthera, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Myrtaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, showy flowers that often resemble tiny lanterns, hence their common name. Plagianthera species are typically found in coastal regions of southern Africa, where they thrive in sandy or rocky soils. They are shrubs or subshrubs with aromatic leaves and are known for their ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions. The flowers are usually white or pink, and they bloom throughout the year, attracting various pollinators.
